derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (originally denoting an object used by the peoples of West Africa as an amulet or charm): from French fétiche, from Portuguese feitiço 'charm, sorcery' (originally an adjective meaning 'made by art'), from Latin factitius (see factitious)

encyclopedia.content: fetish有英语名词和韩国影星宋慧乔的同名电影《Fetish》

entry.tran: (能引起性快感的)恋物癖，恋物
entry.def: If someone has a fetish, they have an unusually strong liking or need for a particular object or activity, as a way of getting sexual pleasure.

example.tran: 迷恋橡胶和皮革的恋物癖

entry.def: If you say that someone has a fetish for doing something, you disapprove of the fact that they do it very often or enjoy it very much.
